Reviews.Title: GREAT 17" LAPTOP FOR THE PRICE!!
Reviews.Author: Ward W. Wilcox
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife to replace a six year old 15" HP laptop that had grown very slow and needed a new battery.  This laptop fits the bill.  It is fast, she loves the larger screen, it is not too heavy and she doesn't have to drag around an electrical cord behind her any more (for some reason she did not want to spend the money on a new battery).  The high gloss black finish looks very good.  She has had no problems with this computer which is wirelessly connected to our home network.  A 17" laptop with these specs at this price is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: DEFECTIVE laptop.  Rude greedy lack of service trying to get HP to honor warranty.
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: Just four months after buying this laptop it started having problems.  The first thing to happen was the rubber stopper that sits on the edge of the upper casing to protect the lid when it closes fell out.  I called the service department and got a run around.  They claimed it wasn't something they could fix under the warranty because they said I caused the damage.I didn't cause the damage.  I'm very careful and gentle in handling all of my electronics.The second thing to stop working was the touchscreen.  Seven months after buying it the touchscreen stopped working.  When I googled around to find a fix for the touchscreen I learned many have had the same problem withsimilar Pavilion laptops made by HP.I called the tech department and then customer service.  After hours on the phone they reluctantly agreed to let me send the laptop in for service.  Still they wouldn't! Honor the warranty.  HP wanted $280. To fix the touchscreen even though it was still under warranty.

Reviews.Title: It's CRAP
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: Hard drive died after 4 months of light use. It was a factory refurb unit. I should realized that HP does NOT stand behind its products when it offers a 90 day warranty (which expired 8/19). Shame on me for buying a refurb HP. Never buying an HP again.

Reviews.Title: PC Sucks, Poor Performance
Reviews.Author: kajnsuga
Reviews.Content: This pc lags in performance. The CD drive does not work properly. Often times it gets hung up for minutes or becomes unresponsive.  Meanwhile the seller refused to refund or replace the item.

Reviews.Title: Bad Buy
Reviews.Author: Ken Gonzales
Reviews.Content: Prouduct only worked properly fro 24 hrs before the screen color starting fading in and out green! Still awaiting refund to my account!

Reviews.Title: Hate, Hate, Hate, Detest and Abhor This Machine!!!!
Reviews.Author: TeaCat
Reviews.Content: Received this computer brand new. Within a few weeks of using it, I discovered that the text will freeze or gray out no matter what program I'm using: Word, calculator, spreadsheets, logging into sites using passwords, entering data online, you name it. This is the most frustrating machine I have EVER had the displeasure of owning. I have consulted computer experts and they always leave scratching their heads over this problem. No one can fix it for me. I have already had to go back and wake up the text four times since starting this paragraph. It's aggravating when I can't even look away from the screen while typing because the freeze will occur without notice and I will have to go back and retype what I thought I had typed already. This is especially annoying when trying to enter passwords; I'll hit enter and then get a message that the password was incorrect, all because the screen froze while I was typing. Additionally, I am forced to restart the computer after it has been left idle for any length of time. If I go back to wake it up, the screen will go black for several seconds and then reappear. It does this over and over, not just once. I find myself having to wait for the black screen to go away so I can see the restart button. All in all, I'm ready to use this computer for target practice and go back to my beloved Toshiba Satellite. GO AWAY, HP!!!!!

Reviews.Title: I wish I could rate this piece of poop lower than 1 star
Reviews.Author: Kristine Walberg
Reviews.Content: I want to preface this review by stating that I have been a loyal HP customer for years, and have owned a series of their printers and laptops that were sturdy, dependable and user-friendly.  I've also been a loyal Microsoft customer both at home and in an office setting.  I've taught computer skills as a corporate trainer and as a library volunteer.  New operating systems and computer programs don't scare me at all.  What does scare me are random inescapable screens dropping down on me in the middle of a project deadline.  What makes my fellow geeks think I want a full-page announcement strobing in my face to tell me I'm not online with Xbox music when I'm balancing my business's books in Excel.  I have never been so annoyed by an OS as I am by Windows 8--and I say that as someone who first used a computer that operated on punchcards, and who once owned a Commodore 64.  Bill Gates, as your next charitable act, would you be so kind as to drive a stake into the heart of this monstrosity?As to the laptop itself, it would be fine if only HP hadn't decided to construct the disk drive tray out of the same material used to make plastic forks for the Dollar Store.  It's brittle.  It's flimsy.  It just hangs there on the underside of the laptop waiting for something bad to happen.  To add to the user's sense of peril, the button to open the drive is stiff and unresponsive, and can only be opened with the extremely careful application of a stylus.This madness began when my sister very generously gave me the 15.6" HP Pavilion.  Within 15 minutes, I'd noted all of the above concerns, but foolishly asked myself, "How bad can it be?"  I got my answer 4 days later when I pushed the button to eject a disk and it promptly fell into the computer, never to be seen again.  Sure that it had to be a fluke, I decided to upgrade to the 17.3" model.  Needless to say, I was equally unimpressed but, once more, hoped for the best.  As befits a higher-priced model, the 17.3" held up to 9 whole days of gentle, intermittent use.  On day 9, I carefully pushed the button to insert a disc.  The drawer slid out slowly, dropping several pieces of Dollar Store plastic in its path.  That was the last sliding it ever did, and it's on its way back to Amazon with its assortment of small broken pieces and its drawer stuck half in and half out.Amazon has been great through all this, they really have, but the fact remains that I'm trying to run a home-based business with no computer to handle shipping records, mailing, bookkeeping and design work.  My business is based on creating products that will last a lifetime and will give my customers real enjoyment.  My #1 goal is make my customers happy.  I wouldn't feel right if I ran things any other way.  If I can do that, with my $0 budget, it's too bad the big guys at HP and Microsoft can't do the same.

Reviews.Title: HP Pavilion g7-224us
Reviews.Author: XmasPink
Reviews.Content: HP Pavilion g7-224us, the quality of this laptop is of poor quality, inserting a cd is almost impossible. Must pry the slot open. Slow, slow process for all programs including booting up. Do not buy!,

Reviews.Title: it was great at first
Reviews.Author: Martha E. Dickinson "mensawitch"
Reviews.Content: I have had HP products forever, though my last desktop I got  a dell.  When I decided to get a laptop I went back to the brand I knew, the customer service is amazing (dvd drive died, fixed no questions no cost easy peasy).  I use my laptop all the time, I am beyond pleased.UPDATE  1 month later screen broke, don't know what happened it was fine, I closed it then reopened a little later and the screen was cracked.  HP has been a nightmare, from intial contact to wanting 300 bucks to fix something that just failed... never again will I use them I am begining to think the good customer service the first time was unusual and this is typicalupdate 2 the laptop is now totally deas, has broken 4 times in less than a year... HP customer service gets worse each time... I will never buy another product from them .. ever ever ever

Reviews.Title: Great laptop
Reviews.Author: Daryl Gates
Reviews.Content: For the amount I paid, this is a great laptop.  It's fast, compact, relatively light and has a good looking case.  The only issues I have are:-The screen is HIGH GLOSS, just like every other laptop made today, I spent weeks looking for a matte screen, and the only people making them are Samsung.  During the day it's a bit annoying, at night so much.-HP BLOATWARE!  Make sure you go into Programs and delete all the garbage they put on here, and be to check your Startup files and uncheck most of the bloatware they load.-The plastic overlays they put all over the laptop are hard to get off, especially around the hinges where the screen attaches to the body, I have to delicately remove tiny bits of plastic with a knife.Other than that everything works well, a dead pixel free screen and great Wifi connectivity.

Reviews.Title: great deal..
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Great laptop for great price. Not that much of a fan of Windows 8 went for the classic startup app. Very fast and great hardware for the price. Screen is very fragile but that's because its LED...nice picture. Must open and close from center of the screen so it doesn't bend side to side. HP put out a great product at a great price. Vendor was great too.

Reviews.Title: Maybe the computer is OK
Reviews.Author: Peter Allan
Reviews.Content: I now have learned how to use Windows 8 from an expert so the computer is fine now. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: It was a bargain.
Reviews.Author: EEALTRE
Reviews.Content: So far so good. The memerory is above average. The keyboard is great. It does everything I need and a little bit more.

Reviews.Title: ABOUT TIME
Reviews.Author: ReneS
Reviews.Content: NETFLIX look really good on this screen. The sound is great, and my only disappointment is that I didn't get the touch screen! ugghh. OVERALL satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: beautiful graphics
Reviews.Author: Mary K. Duran
Reviews.Content: I bought this to stream movies & it works perfectly. Great wifi & super fast USB. Huge hard disk & I can't believe how affordable. It's not the most portable but I have my smart phone for that. This is a wonderful desktop replacement & I'm very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: The best laptop I've ever had!
Reviews.Author: Zac
Reviews.Content: This laptop gets it all done 100x faster than I've ever experienced.  I am very pleased with the whole package.  A lot of people have said they don't like the new Windows 8, but I strongly disagree.  Not only does it have a desktop mode with one click on the "desktop" icon on the start screen, but the start screen is very useful indeed.  It doesn't take long at all to get used to it.  It runs all of my previous software beautifully.  I'm a musician and compose a lot of music and create videos, so it does more for me than any other laptop ever has.  I recommend using either wireless mouse or another USB wired mouse because the touchpad can get a little quirky at times.  Other than that, this laptop has it all.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Zanhdra Rivas
Reviews.Content: Special comes with warranty, and they all arrived very well components shipment and distribution is excellent and very fast, good service and meets specified

Reviews.Title: Left side hinge/case came apart 2 weeks out of warranty.  HP would do nothing!
Reviews.Author: dc
Reviews.Content: The computer worked fine, but the bottom of the case started to separate from the keyboard/top part of the case.  Then, every time the laptop was opened, it would get worse.  Now, the screen won't turn on and the laptop can't be closed.This happened 2 weeks past the one year warranty.  HP would do nothing.  Will never buy another HP product of any kind again.....the first customer service person I spoke with was unsympathetic and nearly rude.This laptop was never dropped or abused.Oh, and Windows 8 is horrible too.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy. Only lasted a year!!!
Reviews.Author: G. Fong "etrekkie"
Reviews.Content: The all USB ports fail today. After 1 year and 15 days. No longer power to the ports. Call HP and waited to talk to a supervisor for 45 mins. They promise they will fix everything and no worry. Only have to pay them $280 to replace the motherboard.This is my spare laptop and I don't even use it much. The mic never worked. I will not buy laptop from HP again!! 15 days over and there is nothing they can do. I expected a little more.Bought this from BestBuy.

Reviews.Title: defective product
Reviews.Author: saul
Reviews.Content: the product was defective when I received itIt appears that the seller does poor packaging (no cushion whatsoever for a laptop!!)happy that it was defective from day one rather than finding out a couple of months later!the return process was smooth and got my refund fast. unfortunately I had to pay to ship it back- not refundable...why? I can understand returning because I did not like or found a better deal..but for a defective or DOA?....doesn't make sense...will not buy from this seller again...

Reviews.Title: Great value for the price!
Reviews.Author: pamela householder
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this computer! It was delivered very quickly, packaged well, and easy to set up, I was able to use it right away! I am still on a learning curve with windows 8, but it was my choice to get it instead of going back to windows 7! Anyway, the price is perfect for my budget and needs at this time, the computer is sturdy, keyboard easy to use, 17+ screen makes it easy to see what I'm doing (!), the processor is fast and the storage is perfect for my needs, specifically photo and document storage. Prior to purchasing online through Amazon, I had researched for a few months then spent an agonizing couple of weeks dealing with ridiculous sales personnel, wrong purchases and difficult returns--all around the holiday's which only accentuated the misery. A good friend suggested I take my research to Amazon and cut out the stress-producing big-box stores and all dealing with them entails! So I took that advice, and ta-da: I'm very happy with the results. In the future when I'm searching for gifts or personal purchases, I will return to Amazon AND HP for electronics, books, art supplies--everything.

Reviews.Title: seller sent a defective unit and then charged me a restocking fee when I sent it back
Reviews.Author: Danyael Laughing Bear
Reviews.Content: do not buy anything from FLOWER Electronics.. they sent me a defective unit and the DVD drive was broken and when I tried to load a DVD into the drive it would not open and I had to take it to a computer repair place to remove the DVD.when I sent the unit back to the seller they charged me a restocking fee for a defective unit.I am in the process of filling a claim with the BBB over this matter and will not ever buy electronics from Amazon ever again

Reviews.Title: Do not buy
Reviews.Author: C. Loppatto "mommyof5"
Reviews.Content: This PC lasted us only three months before it started causing problems. First,  the whole motherboard overheated. The fan on this PC revs high, until it shuts down. we had to send it back to HP to be replaced. It freezes all most all the time. It overheats just after five minutes of use even AFTER the motherboard and fan were replaced. Although it seemed like a good deal at first, this computer is very poor at handling daily computing and I highly recommend not buying. We will probably buy a Dell next time as they have lasted us about 10 years and no problems.

Reviews.Title: took me a while to adjust to windows 8 but that being said
Reviews.Author: sharon pilch
Reviews.Content: great lap top for the price, especially the size of the screen, which was wonderful for me.  Still need to do the update for windows, but love the laptop

Reviews.Title: Nice.
Reviews.Author: Shane Sheppard
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome computer and works great and it can in on time and in great condition. Thanks again for your time!

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed!
Reviews.Author: keephopealive
Reviews.Content: I have owned several laptops and this is the worst ever.  I have only used it for 6 months and already the cooling fan has gone out on it.  And Windows 8 is anything but user friendly, a total pain to navigate.

Reviews.Title: Computer is junk!
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Hunter "nursecindy"
Reviews.Content: I bought this computer just to have something to use at work, to make signs and to use the internet. I have owned it for a year and a half, and it has never been moved from my desk, taken home or anything. I started noticing that the left hinge for the computer was looking strange (raised up a little) and that the screen would be all white sometimes or just kind of multi colored, needless to say it was not right so i called hp to address it hoping that it would be under warranty or something. So after waiting and answering 30 questions and then getting transferred to someone else who told me that my laptop, that i bought 18 months before, was out of warranty but not to worry they would be more than happy to fix it ''like new''. They then put me on hold again to tell me that it will cost $190.00 to fix it and return it. Why would I pay 200 dollars to fix a 500 dollar computer that will still be out of warranty. Hp used to be nicer in my opinion  but after this and my other computers battery that wont hold a charge, this will be the last hp i ever buy.

Reviews.Title: replaced a dell
Reviews.Author: sunnypreposition
Reviews.Content: i bought this when my dell went up. i was very bitter because my dell survived a very rough 4 years and i became a die hard dell promoter. then i had to buy a new one and just couldn't afford the one i wanted. i debated for a while over this model and a lesser dell model and my deciding factor ended up being the numeric keypad. the dell didn't have it. i kicked myself for a year or so but i ended up going back to school so the numeric keypad was a lifesaver for the math class. i hate windows 8 but other than that i have zero performance issues. it's fast and durable as i have a toddler and a cat who both seem bent on ruining everything i own.

Reviews.Title: Pavilion computer
Reviews.Author: D. B. Kopelov
Reviews.Content: My experience did not go well. I have always owned HP , but this one seemed to have a glitch.I just wanted a new computer to be trouble free and this one wasn't. I returned it and Amazonwas excellent in taking care of that end. Amazon is still my "GO-TO" retailer.

Reviews.Title: Sloppy Seller Alert
Reviews.Author: Robert McKinley
Reviews.Content: I bought this P.C. because it is refurbished. It was about $100.00 dollars cheaper than a new P.C. of the same make. It arrived last night,and when I opened the box it came in I was very angry and I could not believe the condition this seller would send this out in. The screen on it was never cleaned. It had other peoples sneeze spray all over the screen mixed with spittle I am sure. The keyboard was not much better. I do not believe this P.C. was "Refurbished", because if it was I am sure it would not have went out like this one. I think that is very unprofessionalI will send it back unless the sloppy seller can prove it was refurbished.  BTW it is 3 years old. So I am calling you out seller. Show me proof that it has been refurbished or I will send it back. That is also why I always use a major credit card. They will back you up when this kind of seller is allowed to sell a "USED" P.C. and claim it is refurbished. In my opinion people that do that are thieves and liars. I say beware of "REFURBISHED",get proof don't do what I did just jump into it. One way or the other I will be satisfied. I hope this helps others in their P.C. hunt. This item was also scratched like someone was playingparking lot hockey with it. This seller did not disclose the fact that it is scratched all over the outside.  I say shame on you ba22martin.  Clean up your act if your going to sell on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Meant for light use, not gaming!
Reviews.Author: crosman760broski
Reviews.Content: First of all, I'm not a "verified owner" because I bought this item at a retail store.I have to say, for internet browsing and office work, this is a steal! I can run 10+ tabs, Skype conference call, Microsoft Word and PowerPoint on a dual monitor display without a problem. It has a great wireless adapter. I haven't been able to get Ethernet to work, but that doesn't matter with a laptop.This laptop's weakness is gaming. Minecraft at 15 fps, TF2 at 10-20. If you plan do do any sort of gaming, fork over a little more money and buy yourself a nice Alienware, or even a desktop gaming computer.This laptop comes with a 500GB harddrive, which is more than I could ever hope to fill when it's just documents and pictures.Overall, for basic computing needs, this is a very good deal!

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: Keely Williams
Reviews.Content: I'm enjoying my new laptop it has everything I need and more. I would recommend this laptop to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop but mine get damaged.
Reviews.Author: Ismael Estepan
Reviews.Content: Great Desing and Fast Laptop.After 3 months, the CPU Fan of this laptop stop working, i tried to use HP Warranty but you what? thats a ****, it doesnt work outside from US.I had to fix it by my own, buying a new CPU Fan, and since i dont live at US i couldnt use Amazon A-to-z guarantee because this was delivered to my courier.on my opinion IF you dont live at US buy this on your own riskPD: I NEVER NEVER used this on bed or couch, i used a glass base that dont cover anything. now i bought i laptop cooler pad beacuse i dont want it get broken again.

Reviews.Title: Everything works great
Reviews.Author: Gregory
Reviews.Content: Everything works great on this Laptop. Warning, it is big. I have had no problem with the battery life on it. The only complaint I would have to say is that it does not have backlit keys and if you grab it by the bottom left corner where the cd drive is it seems a little weak.The computer is awesome besides that though.

Reviews.Title: fabulous
Reviews.Author: Austin Jackson
Reviews.Content: This laptop was my high school graduation gift that I just got recently. It is definetly well worth the money. This computer is definetly as advertised, as this version of windows 8 runs very well (literally, I was up and running in about an hour, so its not a terrifying learning curve) . It is also fast, simple, and very sleek. HD videos look beautiful in 1080p and software is very simple and easy to install (include games which run beautifully). If you want a great laptop, CLICK BUY NOW!

Reviews.Title: Great computer
Reviews.Author: Aaron A Richard
Reviews.Content: Love this computer, another great HP product!  Great screen and HD picture, so much better than Windows 7. Love HP computers.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Mary Green
Reviews.Content: Received product when stated in good condition. I have only used the product once but was satisfied with the product

Reviews.Title: Solid Consumer-Grade Laptop
Reviews.Author: Notor
Reviews.Content: I purchased this laptop for my computer illiterate father who needed a new computer and wanted to cut down on the amount of peripherals/cords that came with his old desktop. It's proven to be functional for his purposes and really fits the bill for what someone who uses a computer solely for internet/email/Office software needs.Pros:-Size. My Dad wanted a 17" screen so he could more easily read things and have a better viewing experience when watching video streaming services. This is one of the few consumer-grade laptops that offers the 17" size at a reasonable price, so it's good for this purpose.-Weight. I've owned two performance/gaming laptops and they have both been on the chunky size. This is a relatively thin and lightweight laptop at 17", and the power adapter is quite slim as well. I was pleased with the size/weight.-Software. Came with limited bloatware that I was able to purge easily, also ran Windows 7 which was great for my Dad who was upgrading from a Windows XP computer. Windows 8 would've been traumatizing for him.Cons:-Screen resolution isn't full 1080p. Not really an issue for him (doesn't know the difference) but for someone used to gaming-grade laptop screens it was a little jarring.-Screen quality is a little washed out, not really a sharp display. Gets the job done but nothing to write home about.-Keyboard doesn't have backlit keys.Conclusion:This has been a solid consumer-grade laptop. Lightweight for the size, it has performed well in the 8 months that my Dad has owned it and whenever I ask how it's doing he always responds that it's working "great." I'd recommend if you want a larger laptop screen and a consumer-level laptop experience (i.e. you aren't trying to play games).

Reviews.Title: Great laptop for auxilliary use
Reviews.Author: Beverly Stout
Reviews.Content: I bought this HP laptop because I needed a portable unit to take with me on trips.  I use Photoshop and InDesign and this computer handles both programs nicely.  It has more than adequate RAM and storage.  I also learned to use Windows 8 which came preloaded.  HP support is the best I've ever found; they have programs on this computer that goes through checklists to troubleshoot if you encounter a problem.  I highly recommend this or any HP product.

Reviews.Title: Great if you get past windows 8
Reviews.Author: Hippie Child Terra
Reviews.Content: I love my laptop, but windows 8 seriously sucks. It doesn't even come with a start menu. My husband had to download something to give it a start menu and since then it is way better. I still really don't like things like the picture viewer and stuff, it's so hard to use and navigate. I wish I could order a laptop with any windows version I want, then I would just stick with XP.

Reviews.Title: It is really great!
Reviews.Author: Jane
Reviews.Content: I found it and wanted it for myself, but I already have a laptop so I bought it for my mom and even though it has windows 8 and that is new and confusing it is pretty easy to get used to if you play with it! I really love it. It is a great product. I want to buy one for myself soon!

Reviews.Title: Nice Laptop
Reviews.Author: Debbie Rush
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my son. He has been using it for only about 2 weeks, but is very happy. We had to get our own copy of MSOffice and I am accustomed to having that already installed on my new computers, but I think the price was still a great value.  My son loves Windows 8, but it took me a while to navigate it. I didn't give this 5 stars because we haven't owned it very long, so there is still opportunity for a problem, but so far it is a great laptop.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for me
Reviews.Author: -Paola-
Reviews.Content: Great performance in all the applications I use. Excellent quality-price ratio. I absolutely recommend it without doubt. I love it.

Reviews.Title: Thank you lots
Reviews.Author: tamy truth
Reviews.Content: I like it, cause its what i wanted. However i have a hard time adapting to the new windows 8. But i'm sue i'll get it soon.

Reviews.Title: Great computer
Reviews.Author: Aaron Miller
Reviews.Content: I very much have enjoyed this computer.Very simple and easy to use.Not too many special fancy features to mess you up.Not too sure about Windows 8 and those tiles.Other than that a very good computer.

Reviews.Title: new computer
Reviews.Author: Shoe Lady
Reviews.Content: It came later than we thought it would arrive but all is good and my husband is not complaining about Windows 8

Reviews.Title: nice machine
Reviews.Author: gary schanzer
Reviews.Content: was what I expected and easy to set up and use  Screen is large and it doesn't get hot  Very nice for a non techie

Reviews.Title: hp
Reviews.Author: Rudi Niessen
Reviews.Content: it was well and nice package, arrived in good time and is being used, requirement where and sometime the box is way to big

Reviews.Title: Love this Laptop
Reviews.Author: Di
Reviews.Content: HP makes a good product and this one is a winner also.  Windows 8 took a bit to get used to, but now I love it.

Reviews.Title: My opinion for the laptop
Reviews.Author: Barb Pack
Reviews.Content: I really like the HP Pavillion for its size.The only thing I don't like is the CD-DVD drive keeps sounding like it is trying to do something,and I am not using it. I have had it since Feb.22,2013

Reviews.Title: Great so far
Reviews.Author: Zaeed
Reviews.Content: I see a lot of people giving 1 star for reasons that are not related to the product at all.They hate windows 8, they give 1 star, their shipping took forever, they give 1 star. PEOPLE SHOULD RATE THE PRODUCT!The laptop seems to work perfectly for me. It took me a while (by a while I mean less than a day) to get used to windows 8 but there shouldn't be much of a difference if you leave it on "desktop mode". To shut down, just go to "power options" and set the power button to "shut it down". And if there's anything you need to know, just do a google search..no big deal.The laptop itself is great. Good image and sound, and works well with MMO games. Maybe not made for complex PC games but internet games work perfectly.Turns on and off quickly and stays cool.

Reviews.Title: hp laptop
Reviews.Author: Gilles Braultndow
Reviews.Content: did not like window 8.  impossible  to manuver.  should have stayed with dell inspiron with window xp.  better for me

Reviews.Title: HP vs Dell
Reviews.Author: Richard K. Waite
Reviews.Content: First HP ever.  Normally buy Dell.  Will go back to Dell when this one goes to the junkyard.  Slow system.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth D. Janz
Reviews.Content: Nice basic lap top.  No extra bells and whistles but it works great.  I have no problems with windows 8.  I wish it had a few of the functions like touch mute etc but for the price a very nice computer.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: tanya blondiau
Reviews.Content: This laptop performs beyond my expectation!! It is so user friendly and I love that it is app based.  Thanks.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: robin
Reviews.Content: it work great and it was more than i expected to very fast and like the big screen beautiful picture

Reviews.Title: very wonderful`
Reviews.Author: teddyomen
Reviews.Content: amazing great price must buy beautiful sound lovely size wonderful to watch movies amazingly great. i use it everyday for entertainment

Reviews.Title: HP laptop
Reviews.Author: cucadare
Reviews.Content: I am more than happy with this laptop. It took a little time to get used to the very flat keys but now with some use I find I like the feel. It has more than enough hard drive to keep me using this computer for years to come. Overall I'm very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop
Reviews.Author: Barbara Phillips
Reviews.Content: I love it. I really wanted another laptop computer with Windows 7 before they go away. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: My new computer and first laptop
Reviews.Author: crazy cat lady
Reviews.Content: I chose HP because I have had good success in the past with HP products.  I love the wide screen!  I know I will love it even more when I figure out Windows 8.

Reviews.Title: NEVER
Reviews.Author: Linda Haycock
Reviews.Content: NEVER BUY FROM THIS COMPANY.  I SPENT $800 FOR A LAPTOP AND HAD TO HAVE THE HARDRIVE AND CD DRIVE REPLACED, TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE, PLEASE TAKE IT FROM ME AND NEVER SPEND YOUR HARD EARNED MONEY ON ANYTHING THIS MANUFACTURER MAKES, TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE.  I CANNOT STRESS THIS ENOUGH.

Reviews.Title: Hate Hate Windows 8
Reviews.Author: Hate Hate Windows 8
Reviews.Content: Don't buy any computer with the Windows 8 operating system installed.  It was made for tablet-type products and is a complete, utter disaster for laptop and desktop applications.  I am a long-time heavy user of Windows products and, ironically, believe Windows 7 one of the best operating systems anywhere.  Windows 8 is more than frustrating, it is infuriating.  And don't think you can buy a computer with Windows 8 then just have Windows 7 installed as several close friends say this doesn't always work.  Your best bet is to buy a computer with Windows 7 already installed or go to Apple.

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: Helen May "Helen May"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my son as his Christmas gift.  He loved it...it is now one of his best gifts ever.  Speedy delivery which I appreciated since I bought it very close to Christmas Day.

Reviews.Title: difficult to learn a new system.
Reviews.Author: Ian Montgomery
Reviews.Content: It is missing alot of programs that were on computers in the past. New I have to buy a word program, and outlook express.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Kristin A. Peterson "uRje'sRoze"
Reviews.Content: great starter for someone just getting a laptop. great size and good for everyday use. would get another one if needed.

Reviews.Title: Nice inexpensive laptop.
Reviews.Author: F. Diaz
Reviews.Content: Can't say much about it since this was purchased by my cousin and he is the one using it, but have not heard any complaints from him and he told me he was very happy with it this far.I would say that for the price the specs are not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: ddd
Reviews.Author: richard
Reviews.Content: a computer is a computer and you buy by the specs. The only fault is the charactors on the keys are almost impossible to see in norma light conditions.

Reviews.Title: product key
Reviews.Author: reviewer00
Reviews.Content: Product key received with the prpduct was either invalid or wrong. Item physically good and buttons work great, but mouse tends to stick alot.

Reviews.Title: Windows 8 SUCKS!!! I this is the most un user friendly program I have ever used!!!!!
Reviews.Author: David G Smith
Reviews.Content: I wish you had this computer back, windows 8 is the most user unfriendly program I have ever used!!!!! IT SUCKS

Reviews.Title: Worst laptop ever...
Reviews.Author: Maria Castejon
Reviews.Content: Screen doesn't work at all, remains black all times. Need to connect to a auxiliar monitor. Worst laptop I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: awful!
Reviews.Author: Emmeline Rosales
Reviews.Content: Its one of the slowest computers I've ever used. I defintely had higher expectations for this laptop. I don't know if the the laptop is defective or windows 8 is has glitches either way I'm in the process of returning it. I'm actually quite mad because I'm taking an online course that I can't access because it stops responding and then computer never recovers. I've had to take the battery out about 7 times to get it to restart. ive had this laptop for a month and hasnt been any use to me, and not to mention windows 8 is a bit annoying to navigate. Its not hard but its system that should only be used on tablets. Also the mouse pad button doesn't work when you push it sometimes.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS MACHINE!!!!!
Reviews.Author: L. Golino
Reviews.Content: HP is a nightmare of a company.  They do not care about their customers.  I have now purchased two different HP laptops that cost a total of almpost $1000,and both machine were worthless.  First one (different model) lasted less than two years and then overheated and stoppedaltogether.  I did everything on my part, but it did not help.I really thought this model would be better esp. with cool sense.  After 3 1/2 weeks, the machine began overheating, the coolsense stopped working, and the machine would not shut down or re-start properly because the cooling fans do not work.This is clearly a systemic issue with HP machines.  Yes, overheating can be an issue with laptops, but in many cases itis simply necessary to clear the dust out of the vents, or to update the BIOS.  When I contacted HP for help, the only thing theywere willing to do was to try updating the BIOS.  They were unwilling to try any other diagnostics, and said I had to return my newmachine for repair.  Fortunately I bought from Amazon and can still return under the 30 day policy.  I asked them to please make sureeverything had been tried, to try proxying into my macine, etc.  In the past when HP used Indian tech support, I got decent help.  Butthis is a typical case of an American company that takes its customers for granted, and does not care about them or their business.I explained that I am a writer and can not be without my pc, and that I was not having a lot of other problems (just a couple minor anomalies),and that the machine was really not getting that warm.  They did not care.  Once I was dealing with the case manager, they had made theirdecision not to help me anymore, refused my request for a courtesy in-home repair esp. since this was my second HP machine that failed onme.  I know HP is widely bought, but do not waste your money, and take a chance on having to go through the nightmare of spending weekssetting up your machine, printers, network, etc., and then have to get a new machine and start all over again.  Do yourself a favor andbuy a more reliable machine from a company that values its customers.  I hate HP and am considering filing a Better Business Bureau complaint.

Reviews.Title: WiFi will not work
Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: Just purchased the HP g7-2010nr and the WiFi will not work.  I received it yesterday & spent 2 hours on the phone with HP Support.  They were very nice but the problem is not fixed.  I am going to try one more time with a call to support and if that does not work it will be returned!

Reviews.Title: Thought this would be a great Xmas gift
Reviews.Author: Phil
Reviews.Content: But it's not.  HP makes crap machines.  Just crap, but what can one expect from a company that hires a CEO like that....Problems:  Overly sensitive touchpad.  Spent hours trying to fix that.  Finally just disabled it.  Their support is difficult to understand.  Multiple calls later, we just realized we have  POS for a computer.  HP might be ok for a printer, but is terrible for a laptop.

Reviews.Title: exactly what I needed - at a great price too!
Reviews.Author: justjan
Reviews.Content: with 6g ram and intel i3 dual processor, this baby can handle a multitude of active tasks quickly without dropping internet connection, freezing internet pages or software (docs and excel) freezing - LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: My purvhase
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: The new windows system did take  some getting used to but this is the best laptop I have ever owned.

Reviews.Title: Awkward, not at all user friendly.
Reviews.Author: Famosa
Reviews.Content: Partly I blame Windows 8, which makes using a computer unpleasant.  That's not HP's fault.  They do bear blame, however, for the extremely difficult mousepad, which invites errors.

Reviews.Title: Its ok
Reviews.Author: Eddie
Reviews.Content: You can tell HP cut corners 4 profit.The casing is incredibly flimsy and and thin.I have this habit of drumming my finger in triplets, while waiting.. this is how I know.I order this PC for my mom based on the Specs. MY PC (Acer Aspire phenom II quad core) doesn't rattle when i drum my fingers on the cases (By the mouse touchpad).. And I thought HP was better than Acer. Dont ask why. You can just tell the poor workmanship on the casing.Anyway, the performance is seamless. 6gb of ram (2 more than mine) and 2.3ghz give you the multitasking power you need. I run Music production software on my pc, and it runs smooth, i can only imagine what this PC would do with it. its no i5 processor, but i3 kills!If you're looking for performance (WE WERE) than this is for you, if you're looking for a sturdy PC that can take a bruise.. you might want to reconsider.

Reviews.Title: Muy buena
Reviews.Author: Michel Chaviano
Reviews.Content: Hasta ahora me va superbién con esta adquisición y atendiendo a sus especificaciones no tengo dudas que la relación calidad precio es unas de las mejores, me llego tod en tiempo y además muy bien empacada, hasta ahora ninguna queja, se la recomiendo a cualquier amigo.

Reviews.Title: Not sure what to say
Reviews.Author: john
Reviews.Content: I am always happy with HP products, and I own several of them already.  My problem was with the shipping when I received the computer the screen was cracked.  More than likely in the handling after it was shipped from Amazon but I think These products should have better packaging to prevent this from happening. Not really on Amazon but it needs to be addressed.  I will say that the return went smooth and i was refunded my money in a very timely manner.  Kudos Amazon for that.
